page.title: 12Fernie Castle.
page.content: The first castle at Fernie was recorded in 1353. Up until 1965, when it was turned into a hotel, the castle only had 3 owners. You can still see the fortified tower with slit windows and, in the grounds, a large ice house once used for keeping food fresh. The hotel has 15 bedrooms and attracts many visitors from abroad and mainly America and Japan. They employ 18 people - 3 in the kitchen, 3 at reception, 2 housekeepers, 2 gardeners and some student helpers. Few of these are resident in the area. The castle is set in attractive grounds where the owners hope to grow sufficient vegetables to supply the hotel kitchen.
